entry.title: Re: SAP SF LMS Item/class assignment
entry.content:
Hi @gopher93 

Please note that users cannot self-enroll into Items / Classes unless the Item and Class belong to a Library that the user has access to. Also, Classes can only be added to Libraries that the Item already belongs to.

This is the application's expected behavior: https://me.sap.com/notes/0002394095 

To have a different system behavior, it would be possible to have an enhancement request created for it (as per KBA 2090228), where the Learning Product Management team can further review and assess the requested functionality to be considered in a future release.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Programs , content and SCORMs mass load
entry.content:
Hi @baoyk 

Regarding a tool to mass import programs, currently there is no such tool available within SAP SF LMS. There have been some enhancements requests on it, and customers are welcomed to vote for any open requests and/or create additional ones. For example:

  • HAVING A POSSIBILITY TO MASS UPLOAD PROGRAMS

For more details on enhancement requests, please check the KBA 2090228. In addition to this, your team may also check the possibility of a custom solution, by engaging your company's Partner and/or SAP Professional Services team (KBA 2149831).

Now, regarding the content objects (SCORM, .pdf, .ppt, etc.), it's possible to upload them directly into the SFTP and then massively create the content records within LMS via Item Connector:

  • 2568384 - How to mass upload content files to iContent and create entities?

However, please note that Learning connectors can import thousands of entities in the system, so it's highly recommend that customers engage with our Professional Services organization or a certified Learning implementation partner before attempting to use connectors or any data import.

  • Import Data to SAP SuccessFactors Learning

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: What is SAP Analytics Cloud preview tenant?
entry.content:
1- what is this preview tenant is meant for?
    A Preview tenant is a non-productive test environment that receives updates before they are released to general production tenants. It allows customers to test and evaluate new features in advance to ensure a smooth transition when the updates are eventually rolled out to their live system.
    These tenants are not meant for production work and are updated at a more frequent rate, such as bi-weekly or monthly, depending on the customer's release cycle. 
    Key characteristics of an SAC Preview tenant
2- Can this be used for POC's or sandbox?
    It was designed specifically for the scenario described above.

entry.title: Safety Stock Behavior in V2 Reorder Point Planning – Exclude from Available Stock Consumption
entry.content:
Hello All,

System : S4 HANA Public cloud

I am using MRP Type V2 (Automatic Reorder Point Planning) with lot size EX and a rounding value of 660. After the forecast calculation, the system proposed a reorder point of 869 and a safety stock of 515( service level 99.9%). Currently, safety stock is treated as a requirement and reduces the available stock, which prevents customer orders from consuming the available quantity. I want safety stock to be excluded from consuming available quantity. (refer screen shot)

My availability check (SR) is set to include safety stock, and even if I untick this option, the system behaves the same way. I do not want to manually remove safety stock from the material master.

Is there a way to achieve this without removing the safety stock indicator in the MRP type config? If I remove it, will the calculation differs? Or it just uses the safety calculation in the background and doesnt show or update in the material master ?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: U.S SECURE 2.0 Act - Section 603
entry.content:
@Euna Thank you  for quick response.  Do you have one combined plan or do you have multiple plans?

We have a combined plan that includes 401(k), Roth, and Catch-Up, and we are currently encountering issues with the system behavior.

Configuration: V_74FH_C  :Qualified plan , V_74FH_C :total max :23500. 

VV_T5F99K2_US_BN603 :ROLL

V_T7USBEN03 :  

BC31 and BC32  copied and assigned as below. 

Scenario 1:Employe have Pre tax 25 % and Post tax 20% in IT0169 and last year earning are $176 000 (WT/TB6)  please check below calculation.

In PP03, the employee reaches the 402(g) limit and the excess Roth deduction is not correctly moves to Section 603 Roth Catch-Up.

However, in PP04, only Pre-Tax continues ( 25%) to calculate and redirect to 603. Roth(20%) is no longer calculated nor redirected to Section 603, even though there is still available catch-up capacity.

PP01   
33826.65*25% 8456.66 
33826.65*20%6765.33 
 15221.99 
PP2  
15826.65*25%3956.66 
15826.65*20%3165.33 
 7121.99 
PP2 Limit 22343.98 
 23500 
23500-22343.981156.02 
PP3  
3826.65*25%956.66956.66+199.36=1156.02
3826.65*20%765.33765.33-199.36=565.97
 199.36 only this is the deduction on PP03
PP4  
23826.65*25%5956.66Only Pre-tax is calculated 
23826.65*20%4765.33Post tax is not calculated.

Scenario 2: 

Employee contributes only Roth : 25% ( IT0169) . When annual  limit of 23,500 is reached, SAP stops calculating Roth instead of moving the excess to Section 603 Roth Catch-Up. 

This behavior is not aligned with the Secure 2.0 pivot design, where both Pre-Tax and Roth contributions should automatically redirect to 603 Catch-Up once the limit is reached.

I raised a ticket with SAP, and they advised us to check the ROTH indicator in V_74FH_C. However, when I enable the Roth option, the Pre-Tax amount is not calculating.

My question is:
Do we need to create separate plans, or should this functionality work with a combined 401(k) plan? Has anyone encountered this issue with combined plans, and if so, how was it resolved?

Thank you 

Suneetha

entry.title: 基于抵销科目确定方案的中国新本地化现金流量表-凭证没有出现在报表的原因是什么？
entry.content:
一. 什么是现金流量表
它是反映一家公司在一定时期现金流入和现金流出动态状况的报表。通过现金流量表,可以概括反映经营活动、投资活动和筹资活动对企业现金流入流出的影响,对于评价企业的实现利润、财务状况及财务管理,要比传统的损益表提供更好的基础。 

二. 现金流量表的作用
1)有助于评价企业支付能力、偿债能力和周转能力;
2)有助于预测企业未来现金流量;
3)有助于分析企业收益质量及影响现金净流量的因素，掌握企业经营活动、投资活动和筹资活动的现金流量，可以从现金流量的角度了解净利润的质量，为分析和判断企业的财务前景提供信息。

三. 为何要出具新版现金流量表：
1)原有本地化现金流量表方案存在性能问题、及部分业务场景数据源无法获取的限制；
2)原有本地化现金流量表方案未与核心财务模块的数据源保持一致。

四. 如何检查为何凭证没有进入报表中：
1)首先，您需要检查在配置点“激活在线抵消科目确定”（ID 105333）中，确认分类账和公司代码是否已被激活。
您可以选择一个分类账，然后双击“定义公司代码”。


接下来，选择一个公司代码并双击“定义版本”，并确保在“类型”标签下维护了文档类型。如果该标签处为空，则意味着所有的文档类型均已被激活。

 

2)接下来，检查是否丢失的凭证是在激活之前被过账的。如果是，您可以使用app“为未处理的过账条目确定抵销账户”来将这类凭证涵盖。如果不是，请继续检查在凭证中，总账科目是否已在配置点“定义现金流报表版本”（ID 105331）中维护。

“项目模式”：
•“所有值”–如果使用此选项，系统将显示所有值，即不对显示金额做任何过滤。
•“仅限贷项”-如果使用此选项，系统将仅显示所选项目的贷方总计。此选项仅适用于项目类型为“期初余额”、“期末余额”或“期间总计”的项目。
•“仅限借项”-如果使用此选项，系统将仅显示所选项目的借方总计。此选项仅适用于项目类型为“期初余额”、“期末余额”或“期间总计”的项目。
•“仅限负值”–如果使用此选项，系统将仅显示所选凭证项目在负值情况下的总计。否则，此项目的金额等于零。
•“仅限正值”–如果使用此选项，系统将仅显示所选凭证项目在正值情况下的总计。否则，此项目的金额等于零。

3)如果需要通过文件链追踪现金流目的并追溯清算关系，需要在配置点“定义现金流报表版本”（ID 105331）中配置所有账户类型：现金账户、抵销账户和发票账户。对于抵销账户（账户类型），总账账户通常是供应商或客户的对账账户。

“科目类型”中，提供了三种不同的科目类型。针对直接法现金流量表：
•现金科目–请配置收付款凭证中的现金/银行存款类科目
•抵销科目–请配置收付款凭证中针对现金/银行存款科目的抵销科目，例如：应收、应付账款科目
•发票科目–请配置与收付款凭证有清账关系的发票凭证中的抵销科目，例如：费用、库存、收入科目等

注：在直接法现金流量表中，如您需要以追溯凭证链清账关系来推导现金流的用途，请同时配置“现金科目”、“抵销科目”和“发票科目”。
如针对单纯的总账凭证推导现金流的用途，例如Cr 银行存款Dr 费用，不存在应收应付科目的清账，请同时配置“现金科目”和“抵销科目”即可。

希望如上信息对于您后续对于基于抵销科目确定方案的中国新本地化现金流量表有帮助！

Best regards,

Lola

entry.title: Is simultaneous, automatic GR/GI possible in the case of co-products?
entry.content:
Hello everyone! I hope I could post this question here even though it would be my first post.

In CO11N, I am trying to confirm production order operations of my selected finished product. I had also tried to conduct automatic goods issuance (of HALB/ROH) within the same transaction.

I went ahead and already tried to conduct simultaneous goods movement of my HALB/ROH through movement type 261, and FERT through movement type 101 but eventually got an error specifying that production orders with co-product headers cannot be simultaneously process automatic GR/GI.

Error code: MILL-PC192

For my next step, I simply proceeded to do the following:

・Conducted partial confirmation of the production order

・Conducted goods issuance of my finished products' components

・Conducted goods receipt of my finished product

I apologize for not being able to provide any actual pictures with regard to this, but does anyone have a different workaround for this error code (from their own experience)?

entry.title: 如何在 S/4HANA 公有云版中查找 API
entry.content:
本文内容翻译自How to find SAP APIs for SAP S/4HANA extensibility model

 

如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

如果您想要在SAP S/4HANA Cloud系统中使用ABAP Cloud模式开发拓展，您需要使用SAP APIs以clean core兼容的方式访问SAP标准功能。

本博客提供了查找SAP APIs相关资源的概览，所有资源的内容都是相同的。

 

1. 在Eclipse的ABAP开发工具中

在ABAP development tools for Eclipse中创建您自己的ABAP存储库树（context menu New->ABAP Repository Tree on the project node in the Project Explorer），从Create Tree wizard的列表中选择"Released Objects"，点击Next按钮，输入名称（"Released Objects"）并点击Finish按钮。Released Objects树将被添加到Project Explorer中：

 

 

USE_IN_CLOUD_DEVELOPMENT 适用于S/4HANA Cloud公有云

USE_IN_CLOUD_DEVLPMNT_ACTIVE 适用于S/4HANA私有云

（原因：在Private Cloud/OP版中，有些已发布的APIs被分配给Public Cloud目录。它们存在但没有功能。如果您在自定义代码中使用它们，ADT会显示错误）

 

2. 在SAP Business Acceleration Hub上

SAP Business Acceleration Hub是SAP运营的平台，您可以在那里查找相关SAP S/4HANA产品的SAP APIs：

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Edition

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Cloud Edition

 

请注意，在Developer Extensibility下，您会找到关于ABAP Cloud已发布APIs的详细信息。这里只显示主要对象类型，如行为定义（Behavior Definitions）、CDS视图，Cloud BAdIs。

 

3. 在GitHub上

SAP在GitHub上提供的Cloudification Repository为SAP S/4HANA产品提供相关的SAP APIs列表，格式为.json和.csv文件：

 

Cloudification Repository at SAP/abap-atc-cr-cv-s4hc (github.com)

 

这是一个纯技术列表，可在ATC检查"Cloud Readiness"中复用。除了已发布的对象（也可在SAP Business Accelerator Hub上获得）外，还提供其他技术对象，如类、授权等。该列表与之前ADT种Repository Tree中的内容完全相同。 此外，您还可以查看所有已弃用的对象、经典APIs、不发布的APIs，甚至包括后继者信息。

 

4. 在Cloudification Repository Viewer中

entry.title: UnwRAPping the ABAP RAP Runtime: Inside the Engine & Transactional Buffers
entry.content:
Background

Having worked with ABAP RAP for over quite some years now and after taking quite a few technical interviews, what I observed from my experience is that many developers still struggle to fully understand what happens inside the ABAP RAP runtime — especially around transactional buffering, EML execution, and commit/rollback behaviours.
Hence setting the context of this blog.

➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️

Introduction

The ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP) is the foundation for building modern, cloud-ready, and transactional applications on SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP S/4HANA.

Crucial to its understanding is about its runtime and hence in this blog, we will touch upon and break down the following concepts in an ntuitive way:

  • RAP Runtime Flow
  • RAP Transactional Buffers (Draft & Active)

Let’s start from the foundation.

➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️

ABAP RAP Runtime — The Invisible Engine

When you build a transactional application with RAP, a lot happens behind the scenes in what we call the RAP runtime engine. It’s “invisible” because you rarely write code for many of its steps — but knowing what it does is key to debug & optimise.

The RAP runtime is responsible for orchestrating everything that happens when you call an action, modify data, run validation/determinations, or commit a business object.

Key responsibilities of RAP runtime:

  • Provides draft handling
  • Maintains transactional buffers
  • Runs determinations/validations/actions in the right order
  • Ensures ACID properties for business transactions
  • Consolidates errors, warnings, and messages through REPORTED structure
  • Writes data to the database only after commit

The most important thing to understand: RAP never directly updates the DB during EML calls. Everything goes into the RAP transactional buffer first.

Here’s how the runtime engine typically handles a transactional request (e.g., modify, create, action on a BO):

  1. Receive Request
    The service binding/OData call enters the RAP runtime. The runtime frameworks dispatch this to the correct BO implementation.
  2. Interaction Phase: Loading & Buffering
    • If the request references existing data, the runtime loads the existing BO instance into the transactional buffer.
    • If it’s new data, buffer is prepared accordingly with new instance(s).
    • All modifications (via EML) are made against the buffer, not directly the database.
    • This phase may include edit/draft handling, business logic, change of states.
  3. Save Sequence Trigger
    Once the interaction phase completes (i.e., no more immediate edit tasks), the runtime triggers the Save Sequence.
  4. Consistency Checks & Late Logic
    • The runtime runs final determinations, validations to ensure data integrity.
    • Any failures here cause rollback of buffer (no DB write).
    • Then key generating logic (late numbering etc) happens if required.
  5. Database Write & Buffer Clean-up
    • The buffered changes are persisted and the transactional buffer is cleaned up.

The runtime returns results (FAILED / REPORTED / MAPPED) to the caller.
The runtime can also be further divided into Standard Operations and Non-standard Operations Runtime based on the operation types.
Source : help.sap.com

➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️

ABAP RAP Transactional Buffers

The ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP) does not introduce its own LUW concept, but uses the rules and concepts of the SAP LUW and thus does inherent checks ensure that your application is consistent and stable, also when more than one BO is involved.

RAP uses an internal transactional buffer (in-memory layer) to temporarily hold all data modifications.

It is the key “scratch‐pad” where all modifications happen before anything goes to the database. Think of it like a workspace for your BO operations.

Every operation (create, update, delete, action) targets an instance in the buffer first. The buffer is internal to RAP runtime — you don’t explicitly manage it, you just use EML and commit/rollback.

Why it matters

  • It ensures isolation: multiple requests don’t interfere until commit.
  • It provides a stage for determinations/validations before final write.
  • It allows draft mode: you can work on data in draft buffer without touching active DB immediately.
  • It ensures you can rollback if something fails without partial DB updates — ACID in practise.

Here’s how you visualise it:

 

Buffer Behaviour in Different Modes:

There are two types of buffers Draft Buffer/Draft Runtime & Active Transactional Buffer. Let’s break them down.

 

  • Active Transactional Buffer – The In-Memory DB-Staging Area

The Active Transactional Buffer is used when you work on active instances (not in draft mode).
This handles all temporary changes for active data until COMMIT ENTITIES.No draft tables involved.

When It Is Used

  • When your BO is not draft-enabled.
  • When your BO is draft-enabled but you are working on active instances (e.g., %is_draft = 00).
  • When triggering actions that operate on active data.

What Happens on COMMIT

At COMMIT, RAP takes all pending changes from the transactional buffer, runs validations and determinations, executes the save sequence, and finally writes everything to the database.

 

  • Draft Buffer aka Draft Runtime– Your Temporary Workspace

The Draft Buffer is a staging area inside the RAP runtime that stores unsaved, in-progress work of a user managed by Draft Runtime.

Since RESTful applications require a constant stateless communication with the backend to prevent that transient data is lost when a user session ends, drafts are essential.

Here, for new-draft & edit-draft instances, data gets updates in Draft Database tables only upon COMMIT ENTITIES.

Only on ACTIVATE, it gets converted into Active Instance in a Active Transactional Buffer and then gets persisted to database table on COMMIT ENTITIES.

When It Is Used

  • When you run MODIFY ENTITIES ... ENTITY <X> CREATE with draft modifier,
  • When you trigger draft actions:
  • When you read draft-specific elements.

What Happens on COMMIT

At activation, RAP takes the draft buffer data, runs validations and determinations, executes the save sequence, deletes the draft, and promotes the changes to active database records

The One-Liner Summary:

  •  Active Mode: COMMIT ENTITIES takes the delta from the transactional buffer → validates → determines → writes to DB → commits → clears buffer.
  •  Draft Mode: ACTIVATE  promotes data to active instance → COMMIT ENTITIES runs the full save sequence → deletes draft → commits.

Source: help.sap.com

➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️

What about ROLLBACK ?

1. Discards entire buffer
→ The runtime clears all staged changes.

2. No DB write/rollback
→ Nothing is persisted/rolled back to/from the database.

3. No further validations/actions
→ All remaining processing is immediately stopped.

4. Restores consistent state
→ System returns to a clean, stable state.

 

➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️➡️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️⬅️

Conclusion

If you’ve reached this far, you may now have a clear inside-out view of how ABAP RAP’s runtime and transactional buffers really work.

To wrap up, the runtime is all about buffers, orchestration, and guaranteed consistency.

Understanding this invisible engine not only helps you debug confidently but also helps you design cleaner, safer, more predictable business objects.

If this blog helped even a little bit in strengthening that foundation, then mission accomplished !

Keep exploring, keep building ! 🙂

 

Regards,
Subhajit

entry.title: How to display Microsoft documents along with PDF and Images in SAP UI5 application
entry.content:
Overview:

Displaying Microsoft document type DOCX, PPT, XSLX etc. along with PDF and Image in SAP UI5/Fiori Application.

Business Requirement:

In one of my project, I have requirement where customer want to display all the attachments like docx, pdf, or pptx etc. inside fiori application. So, the user does not need to switch to different application on the system to view documents.

By default, Fiori provides preview capabilities for PDFs and images, but it does not support Microsoft file formats. But Since the customer needs to preview these file types directly inside the Fiori app, I explored alternatives and determined that the Apryse WebViewer SDK is capable of meeting this requirement

Note: This has additional licensing which customer procured in our case. There are few other libraries which you can utilize based on your requirement.

Step by Step Implementation:

  1. Create an MTA project and add a Fiori application to it.
  2. Now, we need to set up the webviewer sdk in the project. Open terminal from fiori application directory and run command npm i @pdftron/webviewer.
  3. Create a lib folder inside webapp and copy the core, ui, webviewer.min.js from node_modules/@pdftron/webviewer/public.

4. For our project, We created html div container which will display the document inside webviewer when user clicks on LoadDocument button.

5. In Controller, on onLoadDocumentPress, we will initialize and load webviewer like shown in below image

6. Open the terminal and run the command npm run start .

 

Note: License would be required to remove the watermark from the document.

Summary:

WebViewer supports viewing multiple document types, such as PDF, PPTX, and DOCX. In the example above, the document is rendered by converting a Base64-encoded string into a blob, but WebViewer also allows loading documents directly using a file path.

For more information, you can refer following link

Detailed code is available on github repo.

entry.title: Top issues faced during Worker Integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
entry.content:
1. Cost Center is missing or is not reflected in Manage Workforce application.

Follow the below KBA: 3555420 - Missing Cost Center in Manage Workforce application after replicating via MDI to S4 - SAP for Me

2. How to delete the work agreement or block a work agreement of an employee?

Blocking of work agreement can be done by scheduling an ILM process. You can do that by following this blog: How schedule ILM Job

3. How to create multiple work agreements for a worker via Import option in Manage Workforce app.

Currently it is not supported to create multiple work agreements via import functionality in Manage Workforce application. You can use SOAP API for mass creation in such scenario.

3563776 - Import Multiple work Agreements with Manage Workforce app - SAP for Me

4.  When creating or updating worker data in the Manage Workforce app, the following error is generated.

Mapping for the payment method is not found. Parameters: XX,XX,XX,.
Message no. FAP_H2R007

This error occurs when the mapping for the payment method which is specified could not be found by the system. To resolve this, follow the below KBA:

3058691 - Payment Method Not Found Error When Creating or Updating Worker Data - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me

5. Number <CENTRAL_PERSON> is already assigned to partner <BP number> for ID type HCM033", Message no. R1477

According to the New BP model, supplier role should be assigned to Employment BP and not Employee BP. This error message occurs when the supplier role has been manually added to Employee BP. Follow the below KBA to resolve this:

3266815 - Error Message "Number <CENTRAL_PERSON> is already assigned to partner <BP number> for ID type HCM033" Displayed After Replication - SAP for Me

6. How to create Supplier or Customer roles in BP?

To create a supplier role in S/4 system, you need to send payment information (Bank, IBAN etc) in the payload.

To create the customer role, check this documentation.

7. How gender information of the worker is stored in S/4 system.

Gender is personal, sensitive data belonging to an employee. Since SAP S/4HANA Cloud doesn’t include a process that needs this information, it isn’t replicated. 

For more information, go through this KBA: 3217150 - Employee replication excludes the "Gender code". - SAP for Me

8. How to set up Service Cost Level (SCL)?

To set-up SCL, follow this blog.

9. How to create a worker, without a business user?

During worker replication, if the username field is passed in the payload, a business user will be created in the S/4 system. To resolve this issue, follow the below KBA:

3563848 - How to create a worker without creating a business user. - SAP for Me

10. "Workforce person does not have active job details" or "Business Partner Role Code is mandatory for creation."

Job Details in Work Agreements are Inactive. At least one Job details of a work agreement should be active. Follow the below KBA to resolve this error:

3581416 - Error while updating or creating of the Worker data - SAP for Me

Any insights, best practices, or examples would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Steps to include a new system to an existing STMS Domain controller.
entry.content:
Introduction

In any SAP landscape, managing system transports efficiently is critical to maintaining consistency across environments. The SAP Transport Management System (STMS) plays a central role in controlling and moving changes between systems such as Development (DEV), Quality (QAS), and Production (PRD).

There are few blogs and guides available on STMS configuration — from setting up domain controllers to defining transport routes. However, this blog takes a slightly different perspective. Instead of covering the standard setup process, I’ll focus on a real-world scenario: adding a new system to an existing STMS domain controller.

In this example, we’ll walk through how to integrate an additional Quality system into an existing three-tier landscape (DEV → QAS → PRD). This will effectively extend the current landscape and demonstrate how to configure transport routes, verify connectivity, and ensure smooth synchronization across all systems.

Whether you’re expanding your SAP environment or fine-tuning your transport architecture, this step-by-step guide will help you add a new system seamlessly to your existing STMS configuration.

In this blog post, we are going to see how we can add an additional new quality system in between DEV and QAS in the TR route and how we can create target groups.

Existing configuration is DS4(Dev)---QS4(Quality)---PS4(production and also domain controller).

Post adding the new system, the TR route will be DS4(Dev)-----QS3(new system)-------QS4(QA)----PS4(domain controller).

Prerequisites

Before starting the configuration, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  1. The new system is fully set up — The SAP installation and post-installation activities (such as profile configuration, instance setup, and client creation) are complete.
  2. RFC connectivity is established — The new system can communicate with the existing domain controller via trusted RFC connections.
  3. Transport directories are shared and accessible — The /usr/sap/trans directory is mounted and accessible from the new system and all systems in the landscape.
  4. User authorizations are in place — The user performing this configuration has the necessary SAP Basis and STMS administration rights.
  5. Existing STMS domain is active — Verify that the domain controller (typically DEV) is configured and operational.
  6. TMSADM user password must be maintained in all the systems (in client 000). The password of TMSADM needs to be consistent within the whole transport domain.
  7. Access of DDIC user in client 000.

Delete the existing STMS config in the new system:

If your new SAP system already has an STMS (Transport Management System) configuration, you’ll first need to remove it before joining an existing STMS domain controller. This ensures there are no conflicts or duplicate entries when connecting to the central landscape.

Follow these steps to clean up the existing TMS configuration from a standalone system:

  1. Log in to the master client (000) of the new system (for example, QS3). Open transaction STMS and make sure you’re logged into the domain controller.
  2. Go to transaction SE06. Under the section Database Copy or Database Migration, click Perform Post-Installation Actions, and confirm with Yes.

  1. When prompted to select the source system for a database copy, choose No.
  2. In the next dialog, you’ll be asked whether to delete the TMS configuration — select Yes.
  3. Confirm the following prompts by choosing Yes until you see a message confirming that the STMS configuration has been successfully deleted.

Once the existing configuration is removed, your system is ready to be added to the main STMS domain controller.

Steps to include the new system to an existing STMS DC

Login to the master client of the new system (in this case QS3-000), and go to STMS. System will give a prompt to add the system to transport domain. In this case we want QS3 to be added to PS4 domain, but in the below screenshot, its showing by default SS4(another system),  click on “other configurations button as shown below.

Give the Domain controller server details that you want the new system to be added as shown below and give save.

Enter the password of TMSADM in Domain controller client

After giving password, QS3(new SID) will be added to domain controller. Now the next step is to login to domain controller client and approve the system.

Login to Domain controller client, go to STMS—Overview—Systems, check QS3(new SID), its waiting to be included. It’s not active yet.

Click QS3---Click Menu—SAP systems—Approve.

Click Yes and you will get one more pop up to distribute the configuration, click yes, after that, system will become active.

Adding the new system to the TR route

Login to Domain controller--- Go to STMS—click on transport routes

Follow the below step and select graphical editor

Click on Edit

 

Select transport layer ZDS4 and Transport layer SAP and delete those lines

Drag the new SID QS3 down and Go to Edit

After selecting “Add transport route”, click on DS4 and draw a line to QS3

You will get a pop up select ZDS4 transport layer and make sure you are selecting consolidation route.

Again repeat same steps and create a route for SAP transport layer.

Create a transport route between QS3 and QS4, this time it will be a delivery route.

After completing this step, click YES

You will get this pop up click yes

Distribute and activate the changes.

Check the activation log for any errors or warnings.

entry.title: Survey-driven Customer Feedback with Service Cloud V2 + SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
When a case is completed, send a Build Apps survey by email -> customer responses automatically update the V2 case.

Overview

Collecting feedback right after a case is closed or completed is one of the most effective ways to measure customer satisfaction and act on low scores quickly. In this setup :

  1. Service Cloud V2 detects when a case moves into the completed status.
  2. Automatically send an email to the customer containing a survey built in SAP Build Apps.
  3. The customer opens the survey, submits a rating and optional comments and he is saves the survey.
  4. Integration maps the submission back to Service Cloud V2 and updates the original case with survey fields.

    This approach gives you a lightweight, mobile-friendly survey experience (Build Apps) and ties responses directly to the case in V2 for reporting, SLAs, and automated follow-up.

    Short story / user scenario

    Silla from “FastNet” support resolves a broadband outage and marks the case completed.
    Immediately the system triggers a short email: “How was your support experience?”
    The customer opens the link, gives 4/5 and a short comment. Within minutes the case in Service Cloud V2 shows the information 
    Survey rating = 4,Survey comments = "Good, but response time could be quicker".

     A business rule checks for low scores (e.g., ≤ 3) and creates a follow-up task(manually or automatically) if needed.

    Prerequisites (checklist)

      • Access to Service Cloud V2 with admin/developer rights to create custom fields, email templates, and business rules.
      • SAP Build Apps account (ability to create and publish a small survey app).
      • Basic knowledge of URL parameters in Build Apps (to pass caseID) and how to configure HTTP action on submit.
      • Custom fields on Service Cloud V2 Case object to store survey responses.                     

          Architecture Diagram

 

   Implementation — Step by step
   Step 1 - Create survey screen in SAP Build Apps
       a.  Create a simple app/page with:

 



         




       




b. Configure the page to accept query string:?caseId=<case-Id>


Step 2 — Add fields to Service Cloud V2 Case
Add custom fields to hold survey data as example
  • ZSurveyRating(Integer)
  • ZSurveycomments (string / long text)
  • ZSurveySatisfiedRating(string)
Step 3 — Create the HTML email template in SAP Service Cloud V2
Create an email template used for case closure notification that includes the survey link with a case identifier.
Example template body 

Replace displayId with the actual placeholder your SAP Service Cloud V2.


Step 4 — Autoflow rule : Trigger email when case is completed
Use V2 autoflow rules to send the template:
  1. Create a rule :
    • Trigger: Case status changes to complete or closed
    • Condition: Optional — case type, priority, or customer preference
    • Action: Send Email (select the template created)
  2. Test by resolving a case and verifying the email is sent to the case contact.
Step 5 — Build an integration endpoint to accept submissions
Sample Service Cloud V2 API call (generic example):
 
PATCH https://<your-v2-endpoint>/api/v1/cases/{caseId}
Headers:
  Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
  Content-Type: application/json

Body:
{
  {
    "extensions": {
        "ZSurveyRating": 5,
        "ZSurveyComments": "Satisfied",
        "ZSurveySatisfiedRating": "4"
    }
}
}

Confirm your SAP Service Cloud V2 API endpoint and payload structure from the Service Cloud API documentation.


The survey data is transmitted from SAP Build Apps to SAP Service Cloud V2.

 


Summary / Benefits
  • Fast, lightweight feedback loop right at case closure.
  • Survey hosted in Build Apps gives flexible UI and easy mobile experience.
  • Responses are tied to cases for reporting and targeted follow-up.
  • Low friction for customers: short surveys increase response rate.

The precondition for variance posting is there is valid material standard cost estimate for the header material of the order.

You could check the Display Material Master app and go to Costing 2 tab.

entry.title: How to check when the expected document is missing in China New Localization Cash Flow Statements?
entry.content:
一. What is the Cash Flow Statements?
Cash flow statement is to report the in and out flow of cash and its equivalents in certain reporting period of one company. The cash flow information is very useful to analyze the company’s performance and capability of debt repayment.

二. Purpose
The cash flow statement is intended to
1)Provide information on a firm's liquidity and solvency and its ability to change cash flows in future circumstances.
2)Provide additional information for evaluating changes in assets, liabilities and equity.
3)Improve the comparability of different firms' operating performance by eliminating the effects of different accounting methods.
4)Indicate the amount, timing and probability of future cash flows.

三.Why issue a new version of the cash flow statement?
1)Performance issues with existing localization cash flow statement product.
2)Inconsistencies with core functionalities.

四.How to check the configuration when the expected document is missing in the cash flow statement?
1)Check whether the ledger and the company code have been activated in the configuration activity Activate Online Offsetting Account Determination for Several Countries/Rgns (ID 105333).
If you need to configure the specific document types, open this configuration activity. Choose one ledger and double click Define Company Code, and then choose one company code.

And then double click Define Version, and make sure the document type has been maintained under the Type tab. If you leave this tab as empty, it means that all document types are activated.

2)Check whether the missing documents were posted before activation.
If so, you can use the app Determine Offsetting Accounts for Unprocessed Journal Entries to process journal entries for which offsetting accounts were not determined previously.
If not, continue to check whether the G/L accounts in the FI documents have been maintained in the configuration activity Define Cash Flow Statement Versions for Several Countries/Regions (ID 105331).

Item Mode:
•All Values If you use this option, the system displays all the values without filtering
•Only Credit If you use this option, the system will only display the credit total for the selected items. This option is only applicable to items with the item type Opening Balance, Ending Balance, or Period Total.
•Only Debit If you use this option, the system will only display the debit total for the selected items. This option is only applicable to items with the item type Opening Balance, Ending Balance, or Period Total.
•Only Negative If you use this option, the system will only display the totals in the case of negative values for the selected document items. Otherwise, the amount of this item would be shown as zero.
•Only Positive If you use this option, the system will only display the totals in positive cases for the selected document items. the amount of this item would be shown as zero.

3)In the direct cash flow statement, if you need to trace the purpose of cash flows with retrospective clearing relationship in document chain, configure all account types: Cash Account, Offsetting Account, and Invoice Account in the configuration activity Define Cash Flow Statement Versions for Several Countries/Regions (ID 105331). Please also make sure that the specific G/L accounts are assigned to all these three account types and for offsetting account (Acct Type), the G/L account is the vendor or customer's reconciliation account .

In the Account Type , there are three different account types available. For direct cash flow statements:
•Cash account configure the cash/cash equiv. accounts from the incoming/outgoing payment documents
•Offsetting Account configure the offsetting accounts from the incoming/outgoing payment documents, for example: receivables/payables accounts
•Invoice Account configure the offsetting accounts in the invoice documents that have clearing relationship with the payment document, for example: expense, inventory, revenue account, and so on
Note: In the direct cash flow statement, if you need to trace the purpose of cash flows with retrospective clearing relationship in document chain, please configure all account types: Cash Account, Offsetting Account, and Invoice Account.
You only need to configure Cash Account and Offsetting Account for pure G/L account documents without clearing of AR/AP accounts, such as document like: Cr Cash in Bank Dr Expense.

Hope the information could help you!

Best regards,

Lola

entry.title: Fit2Standard Excellence (2/3): Exposing the Myths - What Analysis and Validation Really Reveal
entry.content:
Co-author:  Oliver-Jens Götz
***

 In global rollout and standardization programs, differing local narratives are not just a source of friction—they’re an important signal. When some teams argue their processes are “too special” to standardize, and others assume headquarters will override local needs anyway, they’re really expressing concerns about relevance, control, and risk. Almost every country or business unit sees its processes as unique, and that perception shapes expectations long before a rollout begins.

Rather than treating these positions as resistance, they can be used as early input: they highlight where standards need clearer value articulation, where flexibility is required, and where local practices might actually enrich the global design. The challenge is less about eliminating these narratives and more about channeling them into structured dialogue, so that priorities are set on evidence and impact—not on assumptions or fear of losing autonomy.

This is where the Local System Analysis and Template Validation play a role far beyond its technical nature. They expose uncertainties, challenge long-held assumptions and replace organizational doubts with facts.

Local System Analysis: A Mirror, Not a Microscope

Contrary to popular belief, Local System Analysis is not a simple chasing of the potential gaps. It is rather a mirror held to reflect where the processes truly differ, where legal obligations are dictating exceptions and where the variations are supported simply because it was always done in a certain way.
This phase aids to depict the following truths about the local processes:

Uniqueness is not always the case: when the local teams examine their processes with the template, many cases reveal themselves as standard functionalities.

Identified gaps may not necessarily be an issue:  some differences are simply outdated practices; some are transitional behaviors inherited from legacy systems, and some are even local strengths.

Real complexities are discovered: often complexities are the result of historical decisions, internal habits and interpretations rather than legal requirements.

By documenting these findings systematically, the organization gains clarity on a different more granular level than during the preparation phase.

Template Validation: Turning Narratives Into Navigable Decisions

If Local System Analysis reflects the truth of local operations, the Template Validation is where that truth is validated and made usable.

This step addresses the large volume of gaps and conviction that otherwise might not be possible. Through systematic assessment each gap is examined against the following criteria:

  • Is it legally required or simply preferred?
  • Is this solved through configuration or enhancement?
  • Is the need essential or historical?
  • Does it support strategy or merely habit?

What once appeared as a matter of concern becomes a clear set of categories and complexity becomes structured. The Template Validation it helps to gain clarity and the same understanding.

 

Confidence through Clarity:

By the time these two phases conclude, an organization experiences a shift – not in the processes but in the narrative. Discussions become more evidence-based, relationships between the local and central teams become more balanced, and the atmosphere becomes more cooperative and fosters organizational honesty, making the global rollouts sustainable rather than fragile.

***

Related to the articles: 
“A Case Study: Mastering a Complex Rollout at a Utilities Enterprise” - LINK

“Fit2Standard Excellence (1/3): Impactful Preparation and Demo”  - LINK

entry.title: Recurring Automated Reminders for Over Due Steps - SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals
entry.content:
Integration Center + SFTP + Report Center + MDF = Automation Magic!

Executive Summary

This guide walks through how to automate recurring reminder notifications in SAP SuccessFactors for employees with overdue forms (their own forms or forms they are responsible for).

By combining Custom MDF, Report Center, SFTP, and Integration Center, you can build a seamless end-to-end automation that:

  • Extracts form data from SuccessFactors

  • Calculates overdue days

  • Imports data back into an MDF

  • Triggers alert notifications

  • Sends continuous reminders automatically

Technical Architecture :

 

Step 1: Create the Custom MDF

The MDF is the heart of the solution — it holds all incoming form data and drives the alert workflow logic.Create a Custom MDF with effective Dating "Multiple Changes Per Day"

Why “Multiple Changes per Day”?

Because employees can have multiple overdue forms  / Participants of Different Employees Forms, and the Integration Center may import several records for the same user in a single run.

“Multiple changes per day” ensures that every row of data is saved uniquely and triggers alerts properly.

MDF Fields to be Created :

 

Subject User IDString
Current Owner IDString
Step NameString
Current Route Step NameString
Form Template NameString
Subject User First NameString
Subject User Last NameString
Subject User Middle NameString
Step Due DateDate
Over Due DaysNumber

OnSave Rule :

Effective Dating  :

Over Due Calculation : This rule calculates the overdue days dynamically.

Post Save Rule

Triggers the Alert / Document Generation Template based on Overdue Days.

The Over Due Days can be adjusted based on the Business Requirement. The Following Rule was created to raise Alerts reminders for Forms with Over Due Days greater than 0.

Report :

The Report serves as the Data Source to the Custom MDF to send Reminders. A Table Report needs to be Created with 360 Performance Schema with the following Fields

  • Form Template Name
  • Subject User ID
  • Participant ID
  • Current Route Step Name
  • Step Due Date
  • Document ID
  • Subject User First Name
  • Subject User Middle Name
  • Subject User Last Name

SFTP:

Two Folders are to be created in the SFTP, One for the incoming reports from the Report Center and other one for the archive (Files processed by the Integration Center)

 

Report needs to be filtered with the following values:

  1. Step Due Date is not Null
  2. Form Status is in 360 Evaluation Stage
  3. Participant Feedback Status is in 360 Evaluation , Pending and Draft

Report Scheduling :

The Report needs to be scheduled to SFTP in the .csv Format only (Schedule the Report 30 minutes prior to the Integration Center Schedule)

💡Tip:
You can restrict the dataset to specific form templates if reminders are required only for certain forms.


Integration Center - The Automation Engine :

The Core of the Automation is the Integration Center which Pulls the Report from the SFTP , Maps the Data to the Fields in the Custom MDF , Import Them and Triggers the Alerts.

Data Mapping :

 

Custom MDFReport Fields
external CodeParticipant ID
Transaction Sequence NumberDocument ID
Subject UserSubject User ID
Subject User First NameSubject User First Name
Subject User Last NameSubject User Last Name
Subject User Middle NameSubject User Middle Name
Current Route Step NameCurrent Route Step Name
Form Template NameForm Template Name

Pro Tip : If you want to also send Automated Reminders for Modify Stage , Include Modify Stage in the Form Status and add the Field Current Owner ID and Remove Participant ID. Take a copy of the Integration and map the Current Owner ID to the External Code Field

Document Template :

Create a new Document Template with Category Alert

Document Generation Group:

Document Generation Template

Please assign the Group in the Document Generation Template to the Document Generation Template mentioned above

Template Mapping :

Alert Message :

Create an Alert Message under Manage data -> Create  New -> Alert Message -> Assign the Document Generation Group to the  Document Generation Group in the Alert Message

Additional Resources:

Please find the ICD file for the Integration Center and XML file for the Reports attached in the Link

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1fCnvVCnwb4hY_7tTvRUfyA_un01HFfS6?usp=sharing

Final Wrap-Up

With this configuration, SuccessFactors automatically sends ongoing reminders to employees every time they have overdue forms — without manual monitoring.

You now have an end-to-end automated solution that:

✔ Extracts data via reports
✔ Publishes to SFTP
✔ Uses IC to load into MDF
✔ Calculates overdue
✔ Triggers alerts
✔ Repeats automatically
